title: CS 320 vs CS 300
body:
Probably been asked here before but what’s the big difference between these two classes? I know CS 300 is Java and 320 is Python but does CS 320 teach things like OOP and Data Structures similar to the 300/400 sequence just in Python? 

Also which is more useful to take given an interest in attending grad school for Stat/Math/Comp Bio?
comments:
320 isn’t structured for OOP stuff. Both great classes, but if you’re looking for OOP, you’ll want to take 300.
I took both due to the requirement for 300 as an EE major and then 320 as a DS second major. 
Stat/math -> 320 way more useful in my opinion
